clinical_study.brief_title: A Prospective Study of Early Mechanical Stabilization and Bleeding in Disruption of the Pelvic Ring
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study of Early Mechanical Stabilization and Bleeding in Disruption of the Pelvic Ring

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the effect of earlier placement of Circumferential Pelvic Compression (CPC) on resuscitative measures required for life-threatening pelvic ring injuries and to guide the development of future efficacy trials of three advanced resuscitation techniques (surgical pelvic packing, angioembolization, REBOA).

primary_outcome.description: We will document the volume of any blood products given within the first 24 hours following injury
We will document any techniques used to stabilize and/or resuscitate the pelvic injury within the first 24 hours

secondary_outcome.description: Total blood volume loss will be calculated within the first 24 hours following injury
Number of days that patient spends on a ventilator will be documented
Number of days spent in the ICU will be documented
Number of days spent in the hospital will be documented

The GCS is a neurological scale to assess for brain injury. The score is composed of three parts: eyes, verbal and motor. Each component has a different scale. Eyes (1-4), verbal (1-5) and motor (1-6). The sum of all three components result in the overall GCS score (3-15). The higher the score, the less likelihood of brain injury

other_outcome.description: Any deaths that occur between index hospitalization and 30 days post-injury will be documented

intervention.intervention_name: Application of circumferential pelvic compression (CPC) device
intervention.description: Application of circumferential pelvic compression (CPC) device used at any time within 24 hours of injury

study_pop.textblock: Patients with severe pelvic ring disruptions
